articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Kaeson Youth Park
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Kaeson Youth Park
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il went round the Kaeson Youth Park which has been reconstructed into a people's recreation ground on the occasion of April 25, the anniversary of the foundation of the Korean People's Army. 
					 He was accompanied by Secretary Kim Ki Nam, Department Directors Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Yong Il and Kim Yang Gon and other leading officials of the WPK Central Committee and First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kang Sok Ju. 
					
					 After being briefed on the park in front of its guide map, he looked round amusement and service facilities for hours to acquaint himself with the construction and operation of the park. 
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the park has been rebuilt at the best level to remain impeccable even in the distant future. He highly praised the soldier-builders and constructors in Moranbong District for having turned the park into a wonderful recreation ground for people by displaying the spirit of devoted service for people and extended thanks to them. 
					
					 Looking for a long while at the happy working people and school youth and children having pleasant rest by use of the best recreation facilities, he was very pleased that it has become possible to provide people with ample cultural recreation. 
					
					 He said that the youth park at the foot of time-honored Moran Hill is visited by many working people and school youth and children and set forth important tasks which would serve as guidelines for operating the park.
					
					 He underscored the need for the officials and employees of the park to improve the management of equipment and technical control in the spirit of devoted service to people and steadily update its operation in an effort to give full play to the advantages of the socialist system centered on the popular masses in the DPRK.
					
					 It is nice to see the park ornamented with lamplights, he said, stressing the need to more beautifully decorate the park with lamplights suited to the topographical conditions of the park and the peculiarities of its equipment so that the park may stand distinctly gorgeous at night, too.
					
					 Noting that the modern Kaeson Youth Park is a good one that meets the requirement of the new century, he called for sprucing well all parks and recreation grounds including the Mangyongdae Fun Fair and the Taesongsan Pleasure Park like the youth park to provide people with better conditions for a cultural life.
					
					 Saying that it is important to protect the natural environment in managing parks and recreation grounds, he underlined the need to preserve even a single stone and tree in the recreation grounds as they are and take thorough measures to prevent the pollution in the mountains and rivers, in particular.
					
					 He underscored the need to conduct the work for creating woodland and greenery under a long-term plan in Pyongyang, in particular, in such a manner as to make the whole city form a huge park and enable the capital city to always preserve its beautiful appearance as a "city in the large park".
					
					 The slogan "We Serve the People!" fully reflects the unshakable will and determination of the WPK to devote everything to the happiness of the people, placing the people's interests above anything else, he noted, calling upon all the officials to live and struggle like true servants for the people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Mongolian FM
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					The minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia asked Kim Yong Nam to convey a personal message from Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam conveyed to the minister a verbal message from Kim Jong Il to Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj. 
					
					 The minister said that the relations between Mongolia and the DPRK have favorably developed over the last more than six decades since the establishment of diplomatic relations.
					
					  He expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various domains including politics, economy and culture in the future, too, and wished the Korean people prosperity.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam also had a talk with a delegation of Koreans in Japan headed by Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, in an atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings on the same day.

articles.title: Gift from Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Gift from Mongolian FM
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The minister handed the gift over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday.

articles.title: Mongolian FM Leaves
articles.content:
Mongolian FM Leaves
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, and his party flew back home on Thursday after rounding off their visit to the DPRK.
					 They visited various parts of Rason City while staying in the DPRK.
					
					 The party visited Mangyongdae, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Arch of Triumph, etc.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Iranian Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Iranian Foreign Ministry Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with the delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Iran led by Vice-Minister Mohammad Ali Fathollahi on Thursday when it paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: DPRK and Iran Cooperate in Culture and Science
articles.content:
DPRK and Iran Cooperate in Culture and Science
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A 2010-2012 plan for cultural and scientific exchange between the governments of the DPRK and Iran was signed here Thursday.
					Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned and from the Iranian side were a delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Iran led by Vice-Minister Mohammad Ali Fathollahi and Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Morteza Moradian.
					
					The plan was inked by Jon Yong Jin and Mohammad Ali Fathollahi.

articles.title: Iranian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Iranian Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Morteza Moradian, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at the embassy on Thursday to commemorate the Day of the Sun and the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 Present there on invitation were Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Jong Yong Su, minister of Labour, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Ri Yong Chol, vice-department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and others.
					
					 The visiting delegation of the Iranian Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Mohammad Ali Fathollahi and staff members of the Iranian embassy were on hand.
					
					 Mohammad Ali Fathollahi said at the reception that the friendly relations between the two countries provided by their leaders have grown stronger in various domains including politics, economy and culture.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the two countries are supporting with each other and hoped that the cooperation with the DPRK government will be held positively in the economic field in the future. 
					
					 Choe Thae Bok said in his speech that the politico-ideological and military might of the DPRK has been further enhanced under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He stressed that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung together with the top leaders of Iran have grown stronger under deep care of the leaders of the two countries.

articles.title: Festival of School Youth and Children Closes
articles.content:
Festival of School Youth and Children Closes
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The 17th national festival of school youth and children to vow loyalty was closed with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall Thursday.
					 The festival showed well the noble ideological and moral world and feature of the rising generation growing to be reliable successors to the revolutionary cause of Juche, remaining intensely loyal to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the youth league and school youth and children.
					
					 Pyongyang, North Hamgyong and South Hwanghae provincial youth leagues won the excellent results in the festival.
					
					 Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, in his closing address called on all the school youth and children to conduct brisk mass cultural and art activities and mass sports activities and take an active part in the social and political activities to play role of the youth vanguard and the children's guard.

articles.title: New Feature Film Produced
articles.content:
New Feature Film Produced
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Korean April 25 Film Studio produced feature film "Application for Party Membership".
					The film tells a story about the heroic feats of soldiers of a forefront unit who breathed their last after protecting the revolutionary site and combat technical equipment associated with the undying leadership exploits of  Kim Jong Il, supreme commander, under an unexpected situation.
					
					 A squad leader, who devotes his all to completing the squad's combat preparations, puts off his application for party membership by himself, comparing what he has done with the efforts exerted by party members to make a breakthrough in any difficult and tough work.
					
					 Seeing him, other members of the squad keenly feel that any application for party membership means an oath of unshakable faith and conscience to be taken by a soldier before Kim Jong Il.
					
					 On his way to the unit after combat training, the squad leader finds a forest fire break out all of a sudden. He loses no time to lead members of his squad to fight the raging flames. They lay down their lives to protect the revolutionary feats of the party and the leader.
					
					 The squad leader and his men set examples in their actions to devotedly defend the leader to enjoy an eternal life as honorable members of the Workers' Party of Korea under the care of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Liver Cancer Diagnosis Program Developed
articles.content:
Liver Cancer Diagnosis Program Developed
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A program for early diagnosis and treatment of liver cancer, is working well at Pyongyang Municipal People's Hospital No. 1.
					 The software, after getting some information about health condition of a patient and his or her family members through a dialog box and data of medical checkup, gives a correct diagnosis, including size of cancer.
					
					 It offers both modern and traditional therapies of liver cancer as well as prophylactic treatment methods.
					
					 It, for the accuracy of diagnosis, shows normal liver in dimensional way and hundreds of ultrasonic and CT images of livers classified into vague and model ones.
					
					 The accuracy of the program is as high as 91.8 percent. 
					
					 Users of the program can get common knowledge of liver cancer, too.
					
					 The program, which helps not only experts but also ordinary people diagnose liver cancer easily for early treatment, was developed by  Kim Myong Ho, 38, a doctor of the afore-said hospital.

articles.title: Dedication to Solution to Rural Question
articles.content:
Dedication to Solution to Rural Question
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung paid deep concern to the effort for a solution to the rural question in his lifetime.
					 For this purpose, he visited many rural communities in all parts of the country.
					
					 After the ceasefire in Korea, he went to Changsong County, North Phyongan Province to encourage its peasants to turn their poor county into a place good to live in. At that time, many of them wanted to move to plain areas as they could not be well off in the mountainous area.
					
					 Under his wise leadership and deep care, the seat and farm villages of the county have undergone a cataclysmic change, making good use of mountains.
					
					 The President had the construction of 200,000 houses in the countryside included in the five-year national economic plan (1957-1961) in order to replace peasants grass huts with modern houses.
					
					 He then indicated ways of simultaneously pushing ahead with vast projects of city and rural construction to narrow the distinctions between towns and the countryside.
					
					 Thanks to his energetic guidance, great achievements have been made in the rural construction with farm villages turned into fairylands of the socialist country.

articles.title: US and S. Korean Warmongers' War Exercises under Fire
articles.content:
US and S. Korean Warmongers' War Exercises under Fire
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- It was recently reported that the U.S. forces and the south Korean puppet army staged what they called "combined live shell firing exercises" in Phochon of Kyonggi Province with huge armed forces and ultramodern war hardware involved.
					 These war maneuvers were staged under the simulated conditions of an actual battle. F-16 fighter bombers and copters with different missions mounted a preemptive attack on the "enemy's position" to put it under their control and tanks that had been hurled into the "rear" seized the "enemy's trench," supported by copters, and "advanced" towards "the enemy's position," firing live shells.
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is crystal clear to all that by the imaginary enemy's position in the war exercises the warmongers meant the position of the Korean People's Army and the above-said war exercises were, in the final analysis, undisguised war saber-rattling targeted against the DPRK.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S. and the south Korean conservative group staged the war exercises on April 15.
					
					 They must be well aware that this Day of the Sun is significantly commemorated not only by the Koreans but by all other progressives.
					
					 This being a hard reality, they fixed this day for staging exercises for firing live shells at "enemy's position" with so huge armed forces and various type ultramodern military hardware involved. This clearly indicates how desperately they work to get on the nerves of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK.
					
					 The recent saber-rattling goes to prove once again that the U.S. and the south Korean conservatives are pushing ahead with the preparations for a war of aggression against the DPRK in real earnest after making its outbreak an established fact.
					
					 Its army and people will blow up the stronghold of the aggressors, should they dare ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					They would be well advised to behave themselves, bearing this in mind.

articles.title: Punishment of Dictatorial Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Punishment of Dictatorial Regime Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration on April 19 issued a statement titled "Let Us Condemn the Present Regime in the Same  Spirit as Displayed during the April 19 Uprising." 
					 The statement said that the April 19 Uprising which brought down the Syngman Rhee dictatorial regime by force of people 50 years ago clearly showed what miserable end the ruling quarters met while seeking to turn back the clock of history in disregard of the people's will. 
					
					 History has advanced thanks to the struggle of the people aspiring after progress and the above-said uprising was also an expression of the ardent desire of the people for democracy, stable livelihood of people and independent national reunification, the statement noted, calling on all the people to go united in the dynamic actions for punishing the present regime by carrying forward the spirit of the April 19 uprising.

articles.title: Fascist Police Action under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fascist Police Action under Fire in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Preparatory Committee of the Student Committee of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea in a statement issued on April 18 denounced the fascist police for their evermore undisguised suppression of youth and students. 
					 The statement recalled that the police unreasonably arrested Kim Hyon Ung, student of Jonnam National University, the former chief of the Action Headquarters of the Federation of University Student Councils of south Korea, on April 16, adding that this action fully reflects the present reality of south Korea in which dictatorship has been revived and democracy savagely trampled down.
					
					 It recalled that the fascist police are busy these days with the moves to crack down upon youth and students as evidenced by their frantic activities to issue summons against leading members of the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century on charges of violations of the "National Security Law." 
					
					 Terming this a cynical ploy of the authorities to hold in check the activities of the progressive students with the "election to the local self-governing bodies" at hand, the statement urged the authorities to properly understand the public mind-set and abolish the NSL, a product of dictatorship, without delay. 
					
					 In another development, the south Korean Solidarity of Youth in a statement issued on April 19 denounced the fascist police for arresting two students on their way home after participating in the meeting held on the 18th to mark the 50th anniversary of the April 19 Popular Uprising and declared that the young people would join people from all walks of life in the actions for the release of the arrestees and the freedom of assembly and demonstration.

articles.title: Rampage of Dictatorial Regime Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rampage of Dictatorial Regime Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Seoul on April 17 to condemn the puppet authorities for their anti- reunification fascist actions. It was sponsored by the preparatory committee for the south Korean Solidarity for Democracy, People's Livelihood, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty. 
					 Speakers at the meeting accused some ultra right-wing conservative forces of using the sinking of warship "Chonan" for escalating the confrontation between the south and the north and straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Charging that the authorities have blocked even the tour of Mt. Kumgang by pursuing the policy of confrontation with the DPRK, they urged "Chongwadae" to stop its anti-reunification campaign and opt for implementing the June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					 Deploring that the present situation reminds one of the period of the past dictatorial regime, they called for judging the authorities by force of people for having driven the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe and dampened the anti-"government" spirit through suppression while advocating confrontation and war.

articles.title: Letter of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Chongryon
articles.content:
Letter of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Chongryon
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a letter of thanks on April 20 by the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). 
					The letter referred to the immense excitement and joy with which Chongryon received the educational aid fund and stipends amounting to 184,027,390 yen sent to it by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Central Standing Committee of Chongryon extends the highest glory and the most profound thanks to you for having shown constant fatherly loving care for the strengthening and development of Chongryon and the democratic national education of the children of Koreans in Japan with the noblest patriotism and compatriotic love, the letter said, and continued: 
					
					 We will frustrate the moves of the Japanese authorities and right-wing reactionaries to obliterate the national education and firmly protect and further expand the legitimate rights of the Koreans in Japan including the right to national education, keeping in mind the honor of being overseas citizens of the DPRK. 
					
					 We will glorify this year with innovative successes in the patriotic work of Chongryon including the national education and thus unfailingly repay the fatherly loving care repeatedly shown by you for us.

articles.title: Malta and Syria Figures Issue Statements
articles.content:
Malta and Syria Figures Issue Statements
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Personages of Malta and Syria issued statements to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
					 The chairman of the Malta-Korea Friendship Association said in the statement on April 12 that President Kim Il Sung is the great man who founded the immortal Juche idea and led the Korean revolution and global independence to victory.
					
					 He built a socialist paradise in Korea where the popular masses are the masters of everything and everything serves them and devoted his whole life to the people, the statement noted.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President has been successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, it said, expressing support and solidarity with the Korean people in the efforts to accomplish the President's cause under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The head of a department of the Political Faculty of the University of Damascus of Syria said in the statement on April 14 that Kim Il Sung is the greatest man who is boundlessly revered by the progressive people of the world.
					
					 The statement noted that the exploits performed by him serve as the precious experience and the revolutionary faith and will for the countries and peoples aspiring after independence, justice and equality.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is always alive as the sun in the hearts of the progressive mankind of the world for the undying feats he performed for the Korean revolution and global independence, it stressed.

articles.title: Brazil Parties Support Korean People's Efforts
articles.content:
Brazil Parties Support Korean People's Efforts
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Party for Free Motherland of Brazil and four other political parties of Brazil issued a joint statement in Brasilia on April 13 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 78th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 Recalling Kim Jong Il's saying, "Our building of the country into an economic giant is aimed, to all intents and purposes, at radically improving the people's standard of living. When the people's livelihood is decisively improved, hooray for socialism and singing of Arirang of prosperity can ring out louder across the country and the gate to a thriving nation be opened," the statement said that this aphorism is evoking their sympathy.
					
					 It expressed belief that the DPRK, turned into a powerful political and military power admired by the whole world under the Songun politics, would emerge an economic power in the near future and achieve national reunification without fail.
					
					 Wishing the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people great successes in their efforts to surely open the gate to a thriving nation by 2012 and reunify the country in the spirit of "By our nation itself", the statement reaffirmed their full support and solidarity with the Korean people's struggle.

articles.title: Peruvian Organizations Issue Bulletins
articles.content:
Peruvian Organizations Issue Bulletins
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Bulletins were issued by Peruvian organizations on April 14 to commemorate the Day of the Sun. Portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung were carried by them. 
					 A bulletin jointly published by the General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute and the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship had an article entitled "Korea Today".
					
					 The bulletin in the article said that many works authored by the President reflected his personality as a great man. 
					
					 Noting that the President received highest orders and honorary titles from many countries for the distinguished exploits he performed by turning the DPRK into a country, dignified and prosperous, the bulletin continued: The President devoted his whole life to the sovereignty of the country and the happiness of the people and performed immortal exploits for the times and mankind. 
					
					The DPRK has made dynamic advance under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He is working tirelessly for the building of a thriving socialist nation, creditably carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President. 
					
					 A bulletin issued by the Peruvian Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung said in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, the Eternal Leader" and other articles that the President is still highly lauded by the Korean people and other progressives.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked
 Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings, lectures, book exhibitions, film shows, remembrance meetings and seminars took place in India, Indonesia, Mongolia, Cambodia and Tanzania between April 5 and 10 on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 On display in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and books introducing the vitality of the Juche idea, the Songun idea and the advantages of the DPRK's socialist system.
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					 The director of the Indian Institute for Foreign Policy Studies said that on the occasion of the Day of the Sun they pay respects to Kim Il Sung who made immortal contributions to the human cause of independence and Kim Jong Il who has successfully carried forward his cause, demonstrating the might of the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche said that Kim Il Sung enjoys boundless reverence from all people.
					
					 The rector of the ICC University of Technology of Cambodia noted that the Cambodian people always remember the mental and material support Kim Il Sung rendered to them in the struggle for the independence of Cambodia and building of a new society.
					
					 The chairman of the Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups stressed that the creation of the great Juche idea by Kim Il Sung was a historic event as it opened a new era in the history of mankind.
					
					 The participants in the film shows enjoyed such Korean films as "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Pyongyang at Night".
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at an event held in Mongolia.

articles.title: Rubricado plan de intercambio entre gobiernos de RPDC e Iran
articles.content:
Rubricado plan de intercambio entre gobiernos de RPDC e Iran
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 22 en esta capital el plan de intercambio de cultura y ciencia para 2010-2012 entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Islamica de Iran.
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana, Jon Yong Jin, vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y otros funcionarios correspondientes y por la irani, la delegacion del MINREX encabezada por el vicecanciller Mohammad Ali Fathollahi y el embajador acreditado en Corea, Morteza Moradian.
					
					Lo suscribieron Jon Yong Jin y Mohammad Ali Fathollahi.

articles.title: Clausurado XVII Festival Nacional de Jovenes y Ninos Escolares
articles.content:
Clausurado XVII Festival Nacional de Jovenes y Ninos Escolares
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurado el dia 22 en la Casa Central de la Juventud el XVII Festival Nacional de Fidelidad de los Jovenes y Ninos Escolares.
					El presente festival demostro bien el noble mundo ideo-espiritual de las nuevas generaciones que se forman como confiables continuadores de la causa revolucionaria del Juche infinitamente fieles al Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					La ciudad de Pyongyang ocupo el primer lugar en la clasificacion general.
					
					En el acto estuvieron presentes el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jung Rin, los funcionarios de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, jovenes y ninos escolares.
					
					En el certamen ganaron buenas notas los comites de la Union de la Juventud de la ciudad de Pyongyang, de las provincias de Hamgyong del Sur y de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					Al pronunciar la palabra de clausura, Ri Yong Chol, primer secretario del CC de la citada Union de la Juventud, dijo que todos los jovenes y ninos escolares deben dinamizar las actividades culturales, artisticas y deportivas en masas, tomar parte activa en las actividades sociopoliticas y desempenar el papel de vanguardias de jovenes y de ninos.

articles.title: Filmada nueva pelicula "Solicitud"
articles.content:
Filmada nueva pelicula "Solicitud"
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ATCC) -- Recientemente, los Estudios Cinematograficos 25 de Abril de Corea produjeron la pelicula de ficcion "Solicitud".
					 Este filme se trata de las proezas heroicas de los militares de una unidad en la primera linea del frente, quienes fallecieron tras defender de un siniestro inesperado el lugar de interes historico-revolucionario, en que estan grabadas las inmortales hazanas de direccion del Comandante Supremo     Kim Jong Il, y los equipos tecnicos de combate.
					
					 El cabo, protagonista del filme, trabaja con mucha dedicacion para perfeccionar la combatividad de la escuadra a su cargo.
					
					 Cuando presencia la lucha de los militantes del partido que abren la brecha en los momentos mas dificiles y agotadores, los compara consigo y opta por posponer la presentacion de su solicitud de ingreso al partido.
					
					  En la figura de su superior, los soldados de la escuadra se percatan con el corazon de que la solicitud de ingreso al partido significa el juramento de conviccion y conciencia de los militares ante el Comandante Supremo.
					
					  En el trayecto de regreso de un ejercicio militar, ellos advierten un incendio forestal y se lanzan sin vacilacion en las llamas devoradoras para defender a costa de la vida las hazanas revolucionarias del partido y el lider.
					
					  El cabo y sus soldados, que solicitaron el ingreso al partido con su conducta ejemplar de la defensa a ultranza al lider, reciben el honor de ser militantes del PTC y buscan la vida eterna en el regazo del General Insigne del Songun.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena ejercicio de tiro EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena ejercicio de tiro EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ATCC) -- Recientemente, las tropas norteamericanas y el ejercito titere surcoreano realizaron el "ejercicio conjunto de tiro de combate" en Phochon de la provincia de Kyonggi movilizando enormes efectivos y equipos belicos ultramodernos.
					 En esa ocasion los cazabombarderos "F-16" y los helicopteros de diversos tipos atacaron preventivamente la "posicion enemiga" y seguidamente, los tanques desplegados en la "retaguardia" ocuparon la "trinchera enemiga" con el apoyo de los helicopteros y "avanzaron" hacia la "posicion enemiga" disparando los proyectiles reales.
					
					  Indudablemente, la "posicion enemiga" mencionada es la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y por lo tanto, ese ejercicio fue una abierta maniobra para provocar la guerra de agresion contra ella.
					
					 Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 22 y continua:
					
					 Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que ese entrenamiento tuvo lugar el dia 15.
					
					 Tanto EE.UU. como la banda de conservadores surcoreanos conocen que el 15 de abril es el Dia del Sol celebrado significativamente no solo por el pueblo coreano sino tambien por todos los pueblos progresistas del mundo.
					
					  Este hecho es una prueba evidente de que ellos estan desesperados para provocar e irritar al ejercito y al pueblo de Corea e impulsan en etapa crucial los preparativos para la guerra anti-RPDC considerandola como hecho consumado.
					
					EE.UU. y los conservadores surcoreanos deben actuar con prudencia teniendo presente que si se atreven a desatar la guerra contra la RPDC, el ejercito y el pueblo de esta destruiran por completo el bastion de los agresores.
